products.name: Pipewriter ‚Äî UX App for Writers in Google Docs
products.description:
10√ó Your Copy Decks

(yes, 100% in Google Docs)

All products start with words. Great ones start with killer words of UX-savvy sales copy.

I needed to survive years of SaaS copywriting gigs, so I duct-taped Google Docs into a design-esque app that helps me write really fancy landing page decks, really fast.

Made with üíú for copy-, UX, content, and Oxford Comma writers who understand that words are the heart of product development.

"I've never seen a tool like this that works natively in Docs. I've been building wireframes by hand using tables, even for five-figure contracts. This changes everything for us UX writers."

‚Äî Eoin Cronolly, SaaS Copywriter

1Ô∏è‚É£ Sidebar App

Write Lightspeed Landing Pages ‚ö°Ô∏è

No writer's block. No clicking around Figma. Build stunning wireframes as fast as you type ‚Äî all in Google Docs (where you already write).

üéØ Click or Enter to add 80+ layout elements

üì¶ Pre-built sections ready to customize

‚òØÔ∏è Dark/light mode for docs & elements

üíå Word counts tuned for UX writing

"Thanks Ivan! this looks super cool and is probably 1000x better than the wireframing I've been doing in Gdocs.

‚Äî Warren West, Copy Chief @ WarrenWords

2Ô∏è‚É£ Template Docs

Look Like a Million-Bucks ($10k B2B copy deck)

Top tier copy has to look the part. Not for kicks, but for UX.

You're writing an experience, so you need to visualize the journey to conversion. Do all that ‚Äî in a sweet-looking deck that clients & designers will go üçå for:

üñºÔ∏è Deeply formatted docs

üîÑ Auto-updating text styles

üëÄ Minimalist and whitespacey

üé® Easy to personalize style

"Clients immediately get the vision when they see the wireframe structure. Revisions become much easier or they don't even ask. Plus, for me it's easier bcs I don't have to write long copies just to impress them."

‚Äî Giorgi C. Kynecos, Copywriter

9 template docs
87+ pre-made layouts & components

Start Writing ->

Why the Heck in Docs?

The writer's tool is the text editor. Let's try to upgrade it a bit for the era of UX.

We wordsmiths do all the heavy lifting in a website project ‚Äî research, IA, brand voice, and the actual messaging that talks directly to users.

If movie film have scripts, we can have a more visual way to write product copy.

‚úî UX superpowers where you write

‚úî A ton of stuff to copy-paste

‚úî Always up to date Drive folder and app

üöÄ Beta Launch Special:
$59 One-Time (Until Jan 1st)

The wait is over. Join the first wave of writer-wireframers and get:

‚úî All docs and bound scripts (yours forever)

‚úî Direct support from yours truly

‚úî Early access to upcoming features

Get Pipewriter Forever ‚Äî $59 One-Time

Old template user? Get 50% OFF! Check your email

What's the Beta Catch?

Look, it's my first proper product launch. The core features work great, but you might see quirks, slowdowns or bugs here & there. Getting patched up daily.

Think of it as character development ‚Äî and you get lifetime updates as I polish things up.

Perfect For:

üéØ Copywriters ‚Äî level up from $500 to $5k projects with pro-grade deliverables that look as good as they convert.

‚ú® UX Writers ‚Äî break into tech without learning Figma. Create proper UX deliverables without touching code.

üìä Content Strategists ‚Äî lead with content-first design that doesn't look like an afterthought.

üé® Design Friends ‚Äî (Hey Ran's followers!) Give UI-free wireframing a shot. Words first, pixels/rem/vw later.

10x Your Copy Decks ->

Open-Source: You Own the Code

Each template comes with bound Google Scripts that do the UX magic.

You can inspect the code, tweak it, even steal it ‚Äî no tricks.

Eventually I'll move to a proper add-on, but this version is yours forever.

Want a Sneak Peek? üëÄ

Free preview is coming soon! Drop your email below to get first access üëá

1Ô∏è‚É£ The Sidebar App

Write Lightspeed Landing Pages ‚ö°Ô∏è

‚Äî Warren West, Copy Chief @ WarrenWords

2Ô∏è‚É£ The Template System

Look Like a Million-Bucks ($10k B2B copy deck)

Top-level copy needs to look the part. Not for kicks, but because you're writing an experience. When conversion is king, words and visuals must dance together.

Not for kicks, but for UX. You are writing an experience. For it to convert, you have to think visuals to the words.

The templates give you just the right amount of design thinking (without the design degree) - in a polished package clients will pay more for:

üñºÔ∏è Pre-formatted pageless docs

üî§ Text styles auto-update everywhere (Headings 1-6)

üëÄ Tons of whitespace for room to breathe

üé® Color switcher in-app

"Clients immediately get the vision when they see the wireframe structure. Revisions become much easier or they don't even ask. Plus, for me it's easier bcs I don't have to write long copies just to impress them."

‚úä Copyrighters, rise

Why the Heck in Docs? ü§î

I mean... do you want to click 5 times in Figma just to edit a headline? (And with no word counter to save your life).

It's high time We Web Wordsmiths got product dev tools of our own. After all, we do the heavy lifting of research, IA, brand voice and actual copy that kickstarts digital products.

Heck, if movie films can screenplays üé¨ we can do better than BUTTON: BuY NOw!!1! in Microsoft Word 97 that designers will quietly judge.

Pipewriter is my attempt to fix that, without reinventing what works:

‚úî UX superpowers where you already write

‚úî A metric ton of pre-made stuff to copy-paste away

‚úî Always up to date Drive folder and app

‚úî Fancy upcoming features like AI prompts, exports to Figma and more!

[short video converting doc to HTML, pasting into chatgpt, getting a tailwind index.html)

Built to survive years of SaaS web copy gigs

This is my secret sauce from years of banging out website copy for startups and design agencies. It's my jar of hearts of Doc scripts, bits and snippets, cleaned up and wrapped in a modern app.

So when I say it's made for writers, I mean it.

Perfect For:

products.name: Pipewriter BK
products.description:
10X Your Copy Decks... in Google Docs. UI kit + App for Writers

Just when you've thought you'd seen it all ‚Äî here's Google Docs hacked to bits to become a full-fledged wireframing app.

Why the heck in Docs? Because it's time We The Writers got fancy UX tools of our own.

(without learning to click around in Figma, VS Code, or Microsoft Paint Pro 4.1)

‚ú¶ Wireframes for Writers

If you've been doing copywriting, web content, UX writing... (or designing in a team with writers in it), you know the drill:

Every digital product starts with words.

- Movie films have screenplays
- Apps have user stories
- Websites have copy decks

The best web projects (think $10k+) start with writers who set the tone, voice, word counts, IA. Pretty pixels come after that.

[[ image or gif of workflow // Uploadcare example ]]



‚ú¶‚ú¶ Used by top SaaS & startups... sort of

Pipewriter was built by a longtime old-fart B2B SaaS copywriter (hi, I'm Ivan üëã) trying to speed up landing page wireframe writing for clients.

They seemed to like it, so I kept going, until this internal tool became good enough to share with you‚Äîmy fellow wordsmiths.

[logos]

‚ú¶ Sidebar in Google Docs (click-insert)

Developed in collaboration with NASA scientologists, the app runs in the Docs sidebar,

  • Apps Script bound to your document, and to any copies you make (if you choose so)
  • Latest updates: the app runs from our servers, so you always get the latest version of the GUI (on any number of docs)
  • More integrations coming: Figma, Webapp,

‚ú¶‚ú¶ 100+ UI elements (copy paste away)

Neatly formatted, packed and laid out template

  • Pre-formatted to look the part
  • UX optimized: minimal, clean design
  • Consistent text styles: update headings and body text and update the whole

[img elements all together]


‚ú¶ Earn more for web content

Pro-looking, clean copy decks that mock the website wireframe? Instant 5x the rate.

üí∞ Dress your copy decks to impress and charge more for them

üìê

More importantly, WRITE great work ‚Äî the storytelling comes from us, the writers.


‚òùÔ∏è Dev or designer? Read here!

While Pipewriter is meant for writers, some designers loved using it for quick proto. And if you work in Figma, SvelteKit, React and more, the upcoming webapp will make it easy squeezy to export to these.

The idea is: prototyping

üîó Storyframing on UXDesign.cc ->


[before/after]

Kick it off and start

üî• BONUS: Docs Templates to Kickstart Your Genius

  1. SaaS landing page (so hot right now)
  2. Dark mode SEO landing page (for the cool kids)
  3. Company homepage (impress the suits)


Preview sample page

‚ú¶ Words are the First Prototype

The best websites don't start start with design, they start with copy.


[logos]


‚ú¶ Support webapp dev

If "prototying by typing" appeals to you & you think writers should get a louder voice in product design, support this up as I keep building the webapp.
